basics.name: Greyson Griffin
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm enthralled by the professional world of software development and design. Software development is the culmination of ideas, process, and execution 'for people, and by people.' The initial undertaking of a design problem, and its final, carefully calibrated solution will always be a practice I enjoy.

highlights: Full-stack developer on the Studio, Design and Content team
Developed and maintained Vistaprint's design editor experience
Full-stack developer for Client Administration web-application using DB2/Hibernate/Java/Spring/ExtJS stack.
Converted hazardous shipment processing from mainframe module to RESTful web-service.
Developed user-driven rule configuration screens to replace manual SQL for existing business users.
Full-stack developer for Client Administration web-application using DB2/Hibernate/Java/Spring/ExtJS stack.
Implemented and designed ExtJS front-end screens for business rule manipulation, invoice and billing audits.
Created custom components for exporting customized data grids to excel files, using JSON.
Cut page loads times by 80% for several screens by creating custom local store pagination for data display.
Implemented Spring-MVC for RESTful client-server architecture.
Completed total re-write of heavily coupled COBOL/Apache Struts web-application to ICEFaces with Spring and NamedJDBC.
Lines of Code Reduced from 31,262 to 6,213, Sonar complexity from 3,259, to 965. Sonar Critical Violations from 2,084 to 332.
Optimized dozens of SQL queries to reduce page load times by up to 50%.

education.area: Computer Engineering with Minor in Mathematics
